fund.translation[0].definitions[0].defin: an amount of money that is collected and kept for a particular purpose
fund.translation[0].definitions[0].examp: The fund was set up to try to save the cathedral.
fund.translation[0].definitions[1].defin: an organization that collects money, for example to help people who are ill, old etc
fund.translation[0].definitions[1].examp: We give to the Children’s Fund every Christmas.
fund.translation[0].note_box[0].sections: They have set up a fund to build a memorial to all those who died.
The fund is managed by an investment company.
They plan to launch an investment fund by raising $40m from investors.
Proceeds from the sale of the house will go into a trust fund for the children.
the country’s largest private pension fund
The building is currently owned by Argo Partnership, a Toronto-based investment fund.
These social events help to raise campaign funds.
The work is being paid for out of the memorial fund launched after Morris’s death.
He contributed the sum of £1,500 to the benevolent fund.
The appeal fund has now reached £65,000.
fund.translation[1].definitions[0].defin: to provide money for an activity, organization, event etc
fund.translation[1].definitions[0].examp: The project is jointly funded by several local companies.
fund.translation[2].definitions[0].defin: an amount of money that is obtained and used for a particular purpose
fund.translation[2].definitions[0].examp: They agreed to set up (=start) a $240 million international  fund through which industrialized nations can help developing countries.
fund.translation[2].definitions[1].defin: an organization that is responsible for obtaining and spending money for a particular purpose
fund.translation[2].definitions[1].examp: Thanks to the European Development Fund, a fourth railway station will re-open in Wales this October.
The fund invests in money market deposits with a range of banks and financial institutions.
fund.translation[2].definitions[2].defin: money that a person or organization has available
fund.translation[2].definitions[2].examp: With the additional bank financing, we’ll have sufficient funds to pay our suppliers.
fund.translation[2].definitions[3].defin: having money, or enough money for a particular purpose
fund.translation[2].definitions[3].examp: He promised to send repayment when he was next in funds.
A new spending bill was needed to keep the government in funds (=make sure the government has enough money).
fund.translation[2].definitions[4].defin: to have little or no money
fund.translation[2].definitions[4].examp: The government is short of funds and needs additional revenue quickly.
The company ran out of funds, leaving gross debts of £900 million.
fund.translation[2].definitions[5].defin: used to talk about borrowing for different periods of time
fund.translation[2].definitions[6].defin: a company whose activity is putting money from investors into a particular type of investment or a range of investments, or an amount of money invested in this way
fund.translation[2].definitions[6].examp: The fund will invest primarily in Asian companies.
The GT Growth Fund is the largest investment fund operating in Chile.
fund.translation[3].definitions[0].defin: to provide money for an activity, organization, or event
fund.translation[3].definitions[0].examp: This year’s profits will be used to help fund a record £1.5 billion programme of investment over the next five years.
The chairwoman remains relatively unworried about the group’s ability to fund its expansion.
fund.translation[3].definitions[1].defin: to change the arrangements for paying a debt, so that you have more time to pay
fund.translation[3].definitions[1].examp: Proposals to fund part of the state debt faced stubborn resistance.
